keyword: calories in one cup uncooked rice
title: Calories in One Cup Uncooked Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in one cup uncooked rice, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with quick tweaks and FAQs.
h1: Calories in One Cup Uncooked Rice
assumptions: Long-grain white rice, uncooked, standard US cup measure (~185 g); no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, brand, grain length, and measurement; cooked values differ due to water absorption. Check packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of uncooked white rice provides ~675 kcal, mostly from 148 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup uncooked rice?
faqs.a: About 675 kcal for one cup (~185 g) of uncooked white rice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one cup uncooked rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 148 g of carbohydrates, with 2.4 g fiber.

faqs.q: How does uncooked rice nutrition compare to cooked?
faqs.a: Uncooked is denser; 1 cup uncooked yields ~3 cups cooked with ~200-250 kcal per cup cooked due to water.

faqs.q: Is brown rice lower in calories than white?
faqs.a: Similar calories (~685 kcal per cup uncooked), but brown has more fiber (about 7 g vs. 2.4 g).

faqs.q: Does rice type affect calories in one cup?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”short-grain or basmati may vary by 20-50 kcal per cup; always check specific variety.
